author: Ali Kraish
text: 'Terrible customer service. Food was good but expensive and not worth it. Go to Tao Downtown for that price! Staff was really not friendly at all. When we ordered drinks
column5: they not only took too long but they come back and tell us they don‚Äôt have any more after ten minutes with no complimentary shots or anything! They charge you for everything including sauces. They randomly told us about a ridiculous card charge at the end of debating the bill. Staff just ruins a good vibe.'

author: Olander Wilson
text: 'Meh. Not bad and not overly impressed. Had better sushi. I had the ‚ÄúI like butter and I cannot lie‚Äù (blue crab roll)
column5: surf and turf and my appetizer was the Philly cheesesteak gyoza. I was thoroughly unimpressed with the gyoza. The dumplings description was written very well. Caramelized onions
column6: Asiago cheese and mushrooms. I‚Äôm still looking for those ingredients. I was told it‚Äôs the ‚Äúclosest to a philly‚Äù - hearing that made me excited. The dumpling was stuffed with a piece of meat
column7: not a prime Ny strip steak as advertised. The dumpling was very flaky as I got mine pan seared. The customer service was A-1 by the way. Very friendly and warm hearted.'

author: Raj Murali
text: 'Average service. Decent but not a wow food for the price.'

author: Eric Hammer
text: 'Despite living only a block away
column5: I\'ve only been to Saku once after months of anticipation. Dating back to when the restaurant was in full service
column6: I had heard mixed things going in. My expectations were slightly and pleasantly exceeded.\n\nWe had to wait a while for a table but were able to sit at the bar faster instead and order there. We had drinks at the bar
column7:
both of which were fine but nothing memorable: the Samarai's Widow (the better of the 2) and the Tokyo Rose.

First course was a Toro Tataki special in some kind of truffle sauce; loved this. Any time I can get toro I take advantage. And with truffles? No brainer. Would order again.

We got 3 rolls: I forget the name (it was on the Specials menu) but it had soft shell crab in it
column8: similar to a spider roll. It was the weakest of the 3
column9: but by default.\n\nThe Japanese Jeopardy Roll was a "must try" based on recommendation. It\'s actually a very good roll
column10:
with the added bonus (?) of one VERY spicy piece.

The best roll BY FAR was the Crunch Drunk Love. Our bartender Wil explained that it was a special for a while and was promoted to the everyday menu. I can see why. MUST HAVE in my opinion.

Service was very good albeit a little slow. Busy Friday night though so it was understandable. Wil behind the bar was awesome and helped with my whiskey selection.

The most appropriate rating probably lies somewhere between 3-4 stars. Tie goes to the higher score in this case.'

author: Andrew Gaw
text: "Google & Saku's site mention Delivery. Staff confirmed they don't deliver unless there is Inclement weather or from Winter onwards. Delivery option should probably be updated to reflect the nuance."

author: Joseph Aubourg
text: 'Great service and food'

author: Ryan Kulp
text: 'Sushi is always fresh and ALWAYS consistent. That‚Äôs the reason I‚Äôm writing this review. To let the people know that when you come here you‚Äôll get a fantastic meal. I was also blown away by the outdoor dining experience they provided during COVID. Very attentive staff too
column5: which is great. See ya soon!'

author: Ericka Rodr√≠guez
text: 'Best Sushi üç£ great service üë©üèª'

author: Sthevens Rodriguez
text: "Came here last night for some sushi recommended to me and it was delicious! Omakase appetizer was my favorite since sashimi is my favorite. Super fresh and high quality! Their rolls are great as well. Would highly recommend the crunch drunk love roll. As good and refreshing it was to take a bite of the yellowtail with avocado it blended perfectly with the spicy mayo topped with tobiko. I was impressed with the service
column5: our waitress Emily was very attentive and I appreciated that a lot. This place I highly recommend and I'll definitely be back."

author: Julie P
text: 'The sushi was delicious and fresh with easy and safe pick-up! We will definitely be returning. So happy we tried this place!!'

author: Mila Petrova
text: '(1) Dining at the restaurant\n\nAmazing experience
column5: appetizers were so so good
column6:
the speciality sushi rolls were best I had ever had. Even had Japanese whiskey!

(2) Take out

We ordered basic spicy tuna
column7: sweet potato and spicy salmon rolls...way too much rice
column8: the sweet potato was undercooked. Overall just a terrible meal.\n\nFrom a safety perspective
column9: the restaurant did a good job with providing safe distance for take out...I know they just reopened so maybe still working out the kinks with takeout?\n\nWill be waiting for the reopening :)'

author: Kristina Bodnya
text: 'Ordered a pickup today and it took them OVER 2 HOURS just to prepare it! I‚Äôve received the order confirmation at 6:09pm
column5: it said we can pick up at 7:14. When we arrived
column6: they said ‚Äú30 more minutes!‚Äù I understand it‚Äôs hard times
column7: especially for restaurants right now
column8: but when 30 minutes passed they said ‚Äúanother 10 minutes‚Äù and then another 5 and so on. Eventually the order was ready only at 8:15! We had to wait outside for over an hour
column9: this was beyond ridiculous! The only good thing about their sushi was it was fresh
column10: but for $10 for basic sushi like Alaska roll they could have made it with less rice and more fish at least. Our evening was ruined and I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever order from them again.'

The steak fried rice was delicious and super filling as well. Loved it~<3 Will definitely be back again.'

author: Tim Zheng
text: "Don't go if you are looking for real Asian food"

author: RJ S
text: 'Good ambience with attentive and friendly service.\n\nApps were good (philly cheesesteak gyoza sounds strange but tastes great)
column5: cocktail was watery and lacking and really relied on the mezcal to taste of anything. The speciality Hoboken Brewery Saku beer was great!\n\nThe sashimi is pricey ($4 per piece!) and no sashimi combo on the menu which this place would really benefit from. It really racks up if that is what you‚Äôre after (usually we would share a 16 piece combo
column6: but not here!). Unfortunately it isn‚Äôt anything special. We also weren‚Äôt told it was $4 per individual piece until after the order was in so we felt kind of obligated to stick with it and order more accordingly.\n\nThe sushi roll (we had Dude
column7: Where‚Äôs my Roll?) tasted and looked good. The only problem was the green leaf/roll on the outside didn‚Äôt stick together well and fell apart when you picked it up
column8: so beware when using chopsticks.\n\nOther reviews have compared it to not meeting LA quality and I have to agree. Our favourite local sushi place there is in a grocery store parking lot and the sushi at Saku paled in comparison both on price point and quality consistency. There‚Äôs really no good reason why Hoboken can‚Äôt compete
column9: especially when this menu is at an NYC price.\n\nIn short
column10: we might go back for the rolls
column12: mainly because Hoboken is sorely lacking in Japanese options. Definitely not for the sashimi or the cocktail.\n\nThis is really more of a 3.5 star review but Google doesn‚Äôt allow. I can‚Äôt honestly give it a 4 because our experience was so 50/50 good/distinctly average.'

text: "This restaurant is really an experience - the food and atmosphere are perfect. The cocktails are also so worth the price tag ($14/each). The sushi platter for 2 ($65) was a great way to try a variety of the chef's recommended rolls and every piece of fish was beautiful. Make reservations because it was packed on a Friday night!"

author: Prasad Iyer
text: 'The best japenese restaurant in hoboken. I love the sake they served but the only disappointment was they did not have the hot sake. The food was awesome and the staff is very friendly. The server was very kind and patient when she came to know that it was my first time there and I was taking time to order. She infact helped me order and when I asked her suggestion for which sake to order she brought three different samples of sake to taste and then brought me a glass of the one I liked. It was a very positive experience and I will definitely go back if I visit hoboken.'

text: "Wow

column8:

Vinnie P, 2 years ago, 3, 'Service was STELLAR, first of all, and decor was very pretty. Lobster omelette left something to be desired, roll was too smothered in thick sauce, and Japanese souffle pancakes were too toasted on outside, and partially raw inside. The latter is a difficult dish and rarely found on the menu, but it was a let-down as that was the purpose of the trip. Spicy drink was not for the weak of heart, but the Please Tayku was wonderful.'
Mark Ramirez, 2 years ago, 5, Great
column9: great food. Wonderful atmosphere. Can't wait to go back."

author: Dawn Colbert
text:
'Very good sushi with NYC prices.

Pros:
Melanie was our bartender. She was very professional
column5: personable and helpful! She is great at her job. She made the night!\nMy friend and I went on a Tuesday which is flight night.  A taste of 3 wines for 15 dollars. We started with the Garlic edamame which is sweet and spicy
column6: which I strongly suggest. Then we ordered 2 specialty rolls - Salmon Poke - pretty good and the One and Only Roll (DELISH!) and we shared a fried rice. Melanie told us there is duck in the rice
column7: just in case we do not eat poultry (I am a pescatarian
column8:
so that was great of her to say)  so I went for the vegetarian option. That fried rice was OFF THE HOOK! Kind of obsessed.

Cons:
The wait:
There was a sushi class - so it took almost an hour for us to get our meal.  Melanie was just as surprised at our wait. So I would strongly suggest the staff and the patrons are forewarned that if there is a class
column9: you will wait a painful amount of time for 2 rolls of sushi and bowl of rice.\n\nIt was good food
column11:
good.

The price:
Edamame
2 specialty rolls
One fried rice
2 flights
2 glasses of wine

124 dollars

Come on

author: Joe Brendel
text: 'Love Saku. They did a great job brightening the place up and the new concept is smart. Great cocktails and the fried rice was on point!'

author: TRS- Private
text: 'Being good in this business is hard. We are surrounded by excellence in this corner of he country and Asian Fusion is not unique.\n\nBut Saku in Hoboken deserves respect for being excellent. The sushi was beyond fresh
column5: and the service was impeccable. What a pleasure this experience was from start to finish. My glass was never more than half full before it was refilled
column6: the environment was fun
column7: energized and just right.\n\nThe choice was exciting with traditional sushi as good as anywhere
column8: excellent fusion rolls and a great choice of drinks. This really is the place to go in Hoboken and compares with the best Manhattan has to offer. And the price is incredible. At least half what I would have paid in Manhattan.\n\nTo all of you who run

text: 'Really good sushi and great service'

text: "What Hoboken has finally needed! A sushi spot that isn't cliche like all the other ones in town. Great vibe

author: Carolyn Delia
text: "Ok first off it's the nicest sushi place in Hoboken. Aesthetics aside it had the most unique menu I've seen in a while. Fushikake fries are an absolute must. Beet roll is amazing. Lobster rolls were out of this world. Just go . The kicker of it all was there was live music and it made the whole night ."

author: Jacklyn Cito
text: 'Delicious sushi and very unique sushi dishes. Have never had dessert sushi before and it was delicious. They also have wine on tap which is amazing.'

author: Michael Panayiotou
text: 'I would recommend planning in advance with an early reservation as they get slammed on weekends. I ordered a drink from the bar and made friends with the bartender who was super chill. I got the ‚ÄúBoba Fett‚Äù cocktail which I could drink dangerously fast. It was delicious. My friend and I had a sampling of the menu and everything was fresh
column5: and exactly what I wanted for a night if sushi. I highly recommend. They have their own designer rolls but you can have whatever classic roll you‚Äôd like. This place is great.'

author: sophie lavet
text: "I hate to give this review because this place was needed in Hoboken. That being said I think they have a huge opportunity to improve. First off
column5: whoever created your sushi menu
column6: or who you hired as your sushi chef has got to go...I'm from Los Angeles
column7: sushi is without a doubt my favorite food
column8: I've had Michelin star sushi and strip mall sushi (those places can be just as good) but this truly was grocery store level sushi. I get trying to be more adventurous with the menu
column9: adding rolls like the guacamole is extra
column10: (the guacamole was barely present and flavorless) or the surf and turf roll (supposed to be based on steak and it's ice cold). Anyone who knows sushi (and you should if you're starting a sushi place of this magnitude) knows that the consistency and temperature of the rice is one of the most important factors (watch jiro dreams of sushi) apprentices spend 3 years perfecting how to make perfect sushi rice. This rice was ice cold and mushed together. Additionally
column12: or be honest about what you're using. You said there was blue crab in one of the rolls
column13: it was actually artificial crab. All in all your place will fall off in popularity when people realize how average the sushi is. These are generally sophisticated eaters
column14: who have every opportunity to go into the city and spend this kind of money on sushi. I would truly reevaluate your menu
column16: and whoever you have hired as your sushi chef. Go into the city or to LA and really eat at the best of the best
column18: figure out what they're doing to be successful
column19: and bring it back to Hoboken

author: Gregory Bryan
text: 'FINALLY!! A solid uptown place for refreshing dinner and fun/delicious cocktails.  Don‚Äôt listen to any negative review.  The place is phenomenal.  All of our dishes were tasty
column5: fresh
column6: and left me wanting more.  Our waiter
column7: Chris
column8: was amazing too.  I loved that he gave us the crowd favorites but also his personal favorites - all his recommendations were spot on.  My wife and I will be back very soon.'

author: AJ DeAngelo
text: 'Delicious fresh sushi. Recommended by all the locals. Great for bringing a date. Great cocktails too!'

author: Mary Newman
text: 'Delicious menu & impressive drinks!'

author: Cory Steinberg
text: 'Definitely the best sushi spot in Hoboken
column5: friendly service
column6: and surprisingly reasonably priced'

author: WENHAO YAN
text: 'Best Japanese restaurant in town. Excellent  service and good price.'

author: Shane Oren
text: 'The sushi was FIRE. Be sure to order the baked scallop California roll. Ask Eddy to make it.'

author: Jeremie Pettit
text: 'Great addition to Hoboken
column5: blows away all other Japanese restaurants in town. Korean spiced chicken is truly unique and amazingly delicious. Had the chance to meet the owners Pat and Dan when my wife and I went in for dinner last night and it was obvious they put a lot of effort into the small details which makes such a difference to the overall feel of the restaurant. I was sad when The Turtle Club closed until I went to Saku
column6: not so sad now! 13/10 would recommend
column7: on par with Antique Bar & Bakery.'

author: Irene Tkachenko
text: 'The place looks closed either permanently or for quite some time.'

author: Kevin Devaney
text: "I love this place.   I can't understand why Mondays aren't always packed when it's 1/2 food. The servers are great with personalized recommendations instead of the regular everything is great.  They really know their drinks and what flavors people will enjoy.  Their buffalo chicken dip is fantastic and isn't too spicy.  The Mac and cheese is so creamy"

author: Thomas BOURKE
text: 'Good food and range of drinks. Especially the wine selection'

author: Will Cheung
text: 'Food
column5: drinks and service are all amazing! Very good menu choice.'

author: Pebbles Dr.
text: 'The oysters were quite good and the salmon over couscous was also. The service is super friendly.'

author: Harold
text: 'Great food + drinks
column5: and trying to preserve a piece of  Hoboken history. Love it here! Good range of wines too. Oh
column6: and oysters. Just go!'

author: Amish Shodhan
text: 'Nice and quiet bar across the corner to grab a few drinks in a hectic city'

author: I Z
text: 'good'

author: Erica
text: 'Disappointing we went for a friends 30th birthday party - and it was during St. Patrick Day weekend - it was suppose to be a private event there were drunk people dancing and making a scene in the area reserved for my friend and her family who paid for a private event. A woman was so intoxicated she tried to attack me. Thanks Turtle club.'

author: Kurt Kanaskie
text: 'Top notch
column5: service a bit slow. Great specialty drinks
column6: flaming old fashions!'

author: Melanie Tam
text: 'I had been wanting to try Hoboken Turtle Club for a while now
column5: so when they recently had a Restaurant Week special
column6: I jumped on the chance. Our party of four came in on a Thursday with a reservation for 6:30 and the place was still pretty empty.\n\nFor $25
column7: you get an appetizer
column10: they let you combine with happy hour specials too and Thursdays are 25% bottles of wine. They also have the regular happy hour going on until 8: $3 select draft beers
column13: I went with the bacon mac and cheese. This portion was HUGE. It definitely wasn‚Äôt what I was expecting for an appetizer portion. I ended up bringing most of it home since I still wanted to save room for the entree. But I probably wouldn‚Äôt order this again as it was a little bland.\n\nFor my entree
column14: I went with the short rib cheesesteak. This was great! It had the perfect cheese to meat ratio
column15: and the meat was very tender.  It was a little bit on the salty side but still great overall.\n\nFinally for dessert
column16: I had the pistachio gelato. There‚Äôs a lot of pistachio flavor to it but after a while
column17: you realize that there‚Äôs also a lot of sugar in it.\n\nI wouldn‚Äôt mind coming back in for another cheesesteak
column18: and I‚Äôll definitely be back to try their $1 HH oysters on Tuesdays.'

author: Michael Orozco
text: 'Great food
column5: casual
column6: great wine and beer selections'

author: Thomas Venneman
text: 'The food is decent
column5: the atmosphere is pleasant and the service was spotty and infrequent. The waitress spilled a whole beverage on my fiance and she spent half our time there in the bathroom  under the hand dryer. Kind of ruined the night because it was below 30 degrees and her jeans were soaked... on her birthday.\nWe waited to see what the restaurant would do to compensate for what happened and at the end of our meal the waitress informed us she had taken ONE of the SIX drinks we ordered off the bill ... My fiance gave me that hard look when I became to complain (she doesn\'t like confrontation) and I just paid the bill and left.\nIt was a pathetic attempt of making things right
column6: not to mention the handling of the situation left something to be desired. All the waitress did was bring bar napkins when I asked for a dry cloth towel and or paper towels
column7: which the restaurant "did not have"... I find that hard to believe.'

author: Katsuya K
text:

author: Tania Bailey
text: 'Waitress was great and food was good too!'

author: E M
text: 'Great brunch. We had no reservations...Darren was the host/server she was awesome
column5: sat us right away
column6: she recommended the smoke & mirrors ...you must have... great drink ...it went perfect with my steak and eggs...I will definitely go there again.'

author: Kristielyn Heiser
text: 'Had their Hawaiian draft beer it was really tasty and easy to drink. Their mac and cheese was the best I ever had!'

author: Dan Frigolette
text: 'love em'

author: Paul Cox III
text: 'There for a comedy show only
column5: but cocktails were great and decor was very nice. Great venue and the comedians were fantastic'

author: Valentina Gu
text: 'Wonderful restaurant kind of hidden off the main path. Delicious food and drinks abound. I have to say that their cocktail creations are some of the best in Hoboken. The food is also really good.'

author: Nelson R. Mariona
text: 'Great bar restaurant'

author: Doug Cruickshank
text: 'Nothing special. Reasonable local bar. Nothing to write home about but pleasant enough.'

author: Erica Fitzpatrick Cosgrove
text: 'Always a great late night spot to dance and get a few nightcaps in before heading home.'

author: dennis rice
text: 'Good crowd. Good music. Drinks are on the higher end but still ok price wise. $7 Draft $11 long drinks (vodka bull) Annoying is the $20 card minimum'

author: Sandy
text: 'Second time back. Great food
column5: great bar. The chicken crusted parm is delicious
column6: highly recommend and good portion. My bf had the spicy sausage pasta which was delicious. Had the Kale Caesar as an app and the hummus platter. Very satisfied. The waitress was very friendly. This is one of my favorite places in Hoboken. Highly recommend.'

author: J P
text: 'Bad and boujee'

author: Max Cohen
text: 'During dinner time service slows to a crawl.\nFood was good slightly above average.'

author: Mike Jacobsen
text: 'Great Drinks.  Like the 2 different bars'

author: Kyle Lukas
text: 'The atmosphere is amazing in here and the food is really good! Only reason for not giving 5 stars is that the service is sub-par. Love the charcuterie board!'

author: Mark Jewell
text: 'Great bar
column5: great happy hour during the week and super friendly bar staff. Will be going back. There are two bar areas - both equally nice'

author: Ariel Martin
text: 'One of the best places in Hoboken to get a drink. This place HANDS DOWN makes the best Old Fashion in town
column5: possibly the Tri-State area! Highly Highly Recomended!'

author: Kasey Clark
text: 'Historic building
column5: good cocktails'

author: Jahn Andersen
text: 'Favorite hangout with friends.  Moscow Mule is a must.'

author: Tony Changho
text: 'Standard cozy tavern. Grab a drink and enjoy some 90s music.'

author: Michael Mroczek
text: 'Love the TC Burger'

author: Stephanie Tom
text: 'Good cocktails and a pretty no-fuss food menu. The bar has TVs as well
column5: and is well-lit during the day. There is outdoor seating as well
column6: which is nice for when there is good weather out.'

author: Pat Coleman
text: 'One of the best spots in Hoboken to grab a drink and have some great food. Friendly and knowledgeable staff make this my current favorite spot.'

author: Drew Pronko
text: 'Nice selection of beer
column5: wine
column6: and handcrafted drinks in the center of Hoboken
column7: a bit off of the main streets. Good atmosphere with live music and daily happy hours.'

author: Perry Davis
text: 'Poor service and half their menu was not available. Food was below sub par. First and last time'

author: Juan Ochoa
text:
'The food is great. A bit pricey unless you come for the Monday special or happy hour.

The service was a bit slow and they included an 18% tip on the check.

They have a cool wooden board they light on fire to smoke certain drinks.

The place has a nice layout'

author: Somiran Gupta
text: "Best old fashioned I've had in the tri-state area! Great service
column5: cozy and warm place. Really sad about Alex Hamilton though..."

author: Matt Galo
text: 'Food is really good! Service
column5: though
column6: not so much.'
